item.title: Microsoft May 2025 Patch Tuesday fixes 5 exploited zero-days, 72 flaws
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Today is Microsoft's May 2025 Patch Tuesday, which includes security updates for 72 flaws, including five actively exploited and two publicly disclosed zero-day vulnerabilities. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 KB5058411 and KB5058405 cumulative updates released
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Microsoft has released Windows 11 KB5058411 and KB5058405 cumulative updates for versions 24H2 and 23H2 to fix security vulnerabilities and issues. [...]

item.title: Android 16 expands 'Advanced Protection' with device-level security
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Google is announcing improvements for the Advanced Protection feature in Android 16 that strengthen defenses against sophisticated spyware attacks. [...]

item.title: Windows 10 KB5058379 update fixes SgrmBroker errors in Event Viewer
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Microsoft has released the KB5058379 cumulative update for Windows 10 22H2 and Windows 10 21H2, with four fixes and changes, including one for an SGRMBroker bug. [...]

item.title: Fortinet fixes critical zero-day exploited in FortiVoice attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Fortinet released security updates to patch a critical remote code execution vulnerability exploited as a zero-day in attacks targeting FortiVoice enterprise phone systems. [...]

item.title: Ivanti warns of critical Neurons for ITSM auth bypass flaw
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Ivanti has released security updates for its Neurons for ITSM IT service management solution that mitigate a critical authentication bypass vulnerability. [...]

item.title: New Intel CPU flaws leak sensitive data from privileged memory
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new "Branch Privilege Injection" flaw in all modern Intel CPUs allows attackers to leak sensitive data from memory regions allocated to privileged software like the operating system kernel. [...]

item.title: Microsoft will update Office apps on Windows 10 until 2028
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has backtracked on its plan to end support for Office apps on Windows 10 later this year and announced that it will continue providing security updates for three more years, until 2028. [...]

item.title: Increase Red Team Operations 10X with Adversarial Exposure Validation
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Picus Security
item.description: Red teams uncover what others miss — but they can't be everywhere, all the time. Adversarial Exposure Validation combines BAS + Automated Pentesting to extend red team impact, uncover real attack paths, and validate defenses continuously. Learn more from Picus Security on how AEV can help protect your network. [...]

item.title: M&S says customer data stolen in cyberattack, forces password resets
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Marks and Spencer (M&S) confirms that customer data was stolen in a cyberattack last month, when ransomware was used to encrypt servers. [...]

item.title: ASUS DriverHub flaw let malicious sites run commands with admin rights
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The ASUS DriverHub driver management utility was vulnerable to a critical remote code execution flaw that allowed malicious sites to execute commands on devices with the software installed. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 upgrade block lifted after Safe Exam Browser fix
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has removed an upgrade block that prevented some Safe Exam Browser users from installing the Windows 11 2024 Update due to incompatibility issues. [...]

item.title: Hackers now testing ClickFix attacks against Linux targets
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new campaign employing ClickFix attacks has been spotted targeting both Windows and Linux systems using instructions that make infections on either operating system possible. [...]

item.title: Output Messenger flaw exploited as zero-day in espionage attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: A Türkiye-backed cyberespionage group exploited a zero-day vulnerability to attack Output Messenger users linked to the Kurdish military in Iraq. [...]
